trans-unit.source: Represents a button on the ribbon that displays a drop-down menu when clicked.
The following illustration shows examples of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton> controls in large, medium, and small variations, and with no images.
The following illustrations show <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton> controls when the drop-down is opened.
![Ribbon menu button control with drop-down open](~/add/media/wpfribbon-menubutton-selection.png "Ribbon menu button control with drop-down open")
Ribbon menu button control with drop-down open
![Ribbon menu button control with drop-down open](~/add/media/wpfribbon-menubutton-selection2.png "Ribbon menu button control with drop-down open")
Ribbon menu button control with drop-down open
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this control can be added directly to the Quick Access Toolbar.
`true` if this control can be added directly to the Quick Access Toolbar; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can resize the drop-down horizontally.
`true` if the drop-down can be resized by the user; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can resize the drop-down vertically.
`true` if the drop-down can be resized by the user; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Unloads the container for the specified item.
This method undoes the effects of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton.PrepareContainerForItemOverride%2A> method.
The element that is used to display the item.
The item to display from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition"></xref> for this control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition> contains properties that specify size and visibility information for the image and label associated with a control.
For the default property values, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition>.
Occurs when the drop-down is closed.
Gets or sets the height of the drop-down.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Occurs when the drop-down is opened.
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of the control when it has focus.
The brush that is used to draw the background of the control when it has focus.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when it has focus.
The brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when it has focus.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuItem"></xref> container object that is used to display an item from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Invoked when a mouse button is pressed or released.
This method handles the mouse button actions to prevent the base implementation from closing the menu.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton"></xref> supports custom keyboard scrolling.
Gets a value that indicates whether at least one menu item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGallery"></xref>.
`true` if at least one menu item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGallery"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the drop-down is open.
`true` if the drop-down is open; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets a value that indicates whether the menu drop-down is shown above the menu button.
The menu-drop is displayed above the menu button if it is near the edge of the screen and there is not enough space for it below the menu button.
`true` if the menu drop-down is shown above the menu button; otherwise, `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets a value that indicates whether the control is hosted in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlGroup"></xref>.
`true` if the control is hosted in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlGroup"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the control is hosted in the Quick Access Toolbar.
`true` if the control is hosted in the Quick Access Toolbar; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.

`true` if the item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGallery"></xref>, a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuItem"></xref>, or a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonSeparator"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the control.
A KeyTip must be from 1 to 3 uppercase characters, and must not contain spaces, tabs, or newline characters.
KeyTips are sometimes known as access keys or accelerators and are used as shortcut key combinations that activate controls.
KeyTips appear on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> when you press the ALT key.
The keyboard shortcut for the control.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the text that is displayed next to or below the control.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition.IsLabelVisible%2A> property to control the visibility of the label.
The text that is displayed next to or below the control.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the image that is displayed on the control when the image size is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonImageSize.Large"></xref>.

Set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition.ImageSize%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton.ControlSizeDefinition%2A> to control the visibility of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton.LargeImageSource%2A>.
The image to display on the control.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of the control when the mouse pointer is over it.
The brush that is used to draw the background of the control when the mouse pointer is over it.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when the mouse pointer is over it.
The brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when the mouse pointer is over it.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Called when the KeyTip or accelerator key is pressed.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton"></xref> when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.RibbonMenuButtonAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this control.
A new automation peer object for this control.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlService.DismissPopup"></xref> attached event.
This method closes the menu drop-down and then marks the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlService.DismissPopup> attached event as handled so that the parent drop-down is not closed.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.GotKeyboardFocus"></xref> routed event.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithinChanged"></xref> event.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithinChanged> event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
Called when the KeyTip or accelerator key is accessed.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyUp"></xref> event.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewKeyDown"></xref> event.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewMouseDown"></xref> event.
Invoked whenever the controlâ€™s template changes.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
The element that is used to display the item.
The item to display from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the background of the control when it is pressed.
The brush that is used to draw the background of the control when it is pressed.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when it is pressed.
The brush that is used to draw the outer border of the control when it is pressed.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition"></xref> for this control when it is hosted in the Quick Access Toolbar.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition> contains properties that specify size and visibility information for the image and label associated with a control.
This property specifies how the image and label will appear when this control is hosted in the Quick Access Toolbar.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition"></xref> for this control when it is hosted in the Quick Access Toolbar.
Gets or sets a unique identifier that links a ribbon control to a corresponding control in the Quick Access Toolbar.
A unique identifier for a control in the Quick Access Toolbar.
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> that this control belongs to.
This property is set on the parent <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> control and is inherited by the child controls.
It is used to access visual style brushes defined on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon> class.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> that this control belongs to.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

Returns a value that indicates whether to apply the style from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemContainerStyle"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemContainerStyleSelector"></xref> property to the container element of the specified item.
`false` if container is a or ; otherwise, the value returned by the base implementation.
Gets or sets the image that is displayed on the control when the image size is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonImageSize.Small"></xref>.

Set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlSizeDefinition.ImageSize%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton.ControlSizeDefinition%2A> to control the visibility of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton.SmallImageSource%2A>.
The image to display on the control.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the descriptive text that is displayed in the ToolTip for this control.
Each ribbon control inherits a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, the ribbonâ€™s enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead.
The descriptive text to display in the ToolTip.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the descriptive text that is displayed in the footer of the ToolTip for this control.
Each ribbon control inherits a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, the ribbonâ€™s enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead.
The descriptive text to display in the footer of the ToolTip.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the image that is displayed in the footer of the ToolTip for this control.
Each ribbon control inherits a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, the ribbonâ€™s enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead.
The image to display in the footer of the ToolTip.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the title text that is displayed in the footer of the ToolTip for this control.
Each ribbon control inherits a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, the ribbonâ€™s enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead.
The title text to display in the footer of the ToolTip.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the image that is displayed in the ToolTip for this control.
Each ribbon control inherits a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, the ribbonâ€™s enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead.
The image to display in the ToolTip.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Gets or sets the title text that is displayed in the ToolTip for this control.
Each ribbon control inherits a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, the ribbonâ€™s enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead.
The title text to display in the ToolTip.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
